architecture.subtitle: What I deliver:
points: Clearly structured solution architecture with defined system boundaries and integration paths
Security, identity, and authorization concepts that remain sustainable during growth
Rollout and migration paths with realistic, verifiable milestones
architecture.longtext1: I analyze existing Salesforce landscapes, functional requirements, and organizational constraints to derive resilient solution architectures. The goal is not abstract target drawings, but solutions that function in daily operations and remain evolvable.
architecture.longtext2: I systematically incorporate org health, governance, security concepts, and integrations. Recommendations are not generic but oriented to business model, team structure, and realistic timelines.

crm.subtitle: Focus Areas
points: Integration concepts to ERP, middleware, and specialized systems (REST, Events, Auth)
Definition of clear interface contracts, monitoring, and operational concepts
Data flow and responsibility models across system and team boundaries
crm.longtext: I help integrate CRM systems so that data flows remain comprehensible, operational risks are reduced, and teams can work efficiently. The goal is a system network that promotes acceptance rather than creating additional complexity.

points: Domain boundaries and data models along functional responsibilities
Automations and flows with clear guardrails and testability
Reporting and KPI structures for informed decision support
product.longtext: Clean data models and processes form the foundation of every scalable CRM solution. I help clearly represent business logic, keep automations manageable, and purposefully reduce technical debt.

ownership.subtitle: What Responsibility Means:
points: Clear assignment of technical and functional responsibility for systems and data
Documented decisions with comprehensible justification and consideration
Governance models that sustain beyond individuals and project phases
ownership.longtext1: Responsibility doesn't end with a recommendation. I support organizations in making and documenting technical decisions so they remain sustainable long-term.
ownership.longtext2: Whether point decision assurance, temporary assumption of technical responsibility, or support in building clear ownership models across distributed teams — my focus is on ensuring responsibilities are unambiguous and decisions endure.

ai.subtitle: How we support you
points: Design and implementation of AI use cases such as customer lifetime value, lead scoring, forecasting and personalization
Integration of Salesforce Einstein, Data Cloud, Tableau and GPT-based solutions into existing system landscapes
Transparent, user-oriented AI implementations instead of black-box approaches
Strong data and AI expertise with deep Salesforce platform knowledge
ai.longtext1: We combine business requirements, Salesforce platforms and data science methods to build stable, maintainable AI solutions that fit naturally into your existing IT architecture.
ai.longtext2: Based on CRISP-DM and complemented by a design-oriented approach, we develop AI systems that are understandable, scalable and sustainable in the long term.

faq.title: Questions? Answers.
faq.subtitle: Typical situations and approaches, described from practice.

items.question: Salesforce and CRM landscapes have evolved organically and are difficult to maintain.
items.answer: In such situations, I analyze existing Salesforce orgs, connected systems, and real usage patterns in operations. I make technical dependencies, implicit assumptions, and evolved special logic visible and classify them functionally and technically. The result is a clear solution architecture that shows which parts need to be stabilized, simplified, or redesigned without endangering ongoing operations.

items.question: Multiple solution or integration options are under consideration, but risks and impacts are unclear.
items.answer: I prepare structured decision foundations in which technical options become comparable. This includes trade-offs, integration risks, impacts on operations, data quality and team structures, as well as realistic migration paths. The goal is a decision that is made comprehensibly and endures even under time and organizational pressure.

items.question: Product, Business, and IT have different visions for the same CRM system.
items.answer: I structure requirements, target architectures, and constraints across all involved roles and translate them into a common solution understanding. I clarify what the system should do, what it deliberately should not, and where functional responsibility lies. Decisions are documented and made so they can be supported and implemented by the involved teams.

items.question: Long-Standing Experience
items.answer: I've been working with Salesforce, CRM, and integration systems for over ten years in enterprise and mid-market environments. My experience ranges from operational administration through complex migrations to responsibility for solution design, integrations, and long-term stable system landscapes.

items.question: Strategic Clarity
items.answer: Technical decisions don't emerge implicitly or purely tool-driven with me. I expose assumptions, evaluate alternatives, and formulate clear decision options that consider functional, technical, and organizational impacts. This creates transparency and reduces subsequent corrections.

items.question: Measurable Impact
items.answer: The focus is on stable systems, better user acceptance, and resilient processes. Solutions are designed to ease daily operations, reduce technical debt, and measurably support decisions rather than create new complexity.

items.question: Practical Implementation
items.answer: All solutions are oriented to real teams, existing capabilities, and operational constraints. The goal is not theoretical ideal architecture, but a system that functions in daily operations, remains maintainable, and can be evolved incrementally.
